## Hints

i) Use the command `data(airquality)` to load the dataset.

<br>

ii) Assign a new name with the form `new_name <- airquality`

<br>

iii) Get an overview of the dataset:
     - Number of rows: Check the functions `dim` (`?dim`) or `nrow` (`?nrow`)
     - Number of columns: Check the functions `dim` (`?dim`) or `ncol` (`?ncol`)
     - Column classes: Check the function `class` (`?class`)

<br>

iv) Check the function `mean` (`?mean`). Select the column `Temp` 
(in the form of `df$Temp` or `df[, 4]`)

<br>

v) Check the function `max` (`?max`) and the argument `na.rm`

<br>

vi) Check the function `which.max`

<br>

vii) Use the function `subset` (`?subset`) to filter for the month May 
(`Month == 5`)
